Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery kotyle with trace of handle root; interior glazed black (mostly worn) with two added red bands; exterior: part of rim decoration consisting of a frieze of vertical bars above two lines and a band of triple staggered dots below handle root; below, black-figure decoration consisting of male figure to right holding a spear in right hand (upper body remaining); at left possibly part of feline's tail; incised rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.232) (phase 3)
